title: Meta Tags and SEO
description: Nuxt lets you define all default meta tags for your application inside the nuxt.config.js file using the head property. This is very useful for adding a default title and description tag for SEO purposes or for setting the viewport or adding the favicon.

children.value: Nuxt gives you 3 different ways to add meta data to your application:
Locally using the head as an object
Locally using the head as a function so that you have access to data and computed properties.
Nuxt lets you define all default

tags for your application inside the nuxt.config.js file using the head property. This is very useful for adding a default title and description tag for SEO purposes or for setting the viewport or adding the favicon.
This will give you the same title and description on every page
You can also add titles and meta for each page by setting the
property inside your script tag on every page:
as an object to set a title and description only for the home page
as a function to set a title and description only for the home page. By using a function you have access to data and computed properties
to update the document head and meta attributes of your application.
To avoid any duplication when used in child components, please give a unique identifier with the
key to the meta description. This way
will know that it has to overwrite the default tag.
